quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. - Steve Jobs
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Believe you can and you're halfway there. - Theodore Roosevelt
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts. - Winston Churchill
author: Winston Churchill

quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing. - Socrates
author: Socrates

quote: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens. - Jimi Hendrix
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: To handle yourself, use your head; to handle others, use your heart. - Eleanor Roosevelt
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: The best way to predict the future is to invent it. - Alan Kay
author: Alan Kay

quote: Software is eating the world. - Marc Andreessen
author: Marc Andreessen

quote: The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before. - Bill Gates
author: Bill Gates

quote: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams. - Eleanor Roosevelt
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals. - Zig Ziglar
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream. - C.S. Lewis
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way. - John C. Maxwell
author: John C. Maxwell

quote: The greatest leader is not necessarily the one who does the greatest things. He is the one that gets the people to do the greatest things. - Ronald Reagan
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower. - Steve Jobs
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions. - Dalai Lama
author: Dalai Lama

quote: The purpose of our lives is to be happy. - Dalai Lama
author: Dalai Lama

quote: Happiness depends upon ourselves. - Aristotle
author: Aristotle

quote: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world. - Nelson Mandela
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: The beautiful thing about learning is that no one can take it away from you. - B.B. King
author: B.B. King

quote: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever. - Mahatma Gandhi
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome. - Booker T. Washington
author: Booker T. Washington

quote: Don’t aim for success if you want it; just do what you love and believe in, and it will come naturally. - David Frost
author: David Frost

quote: The secret of success is to know something nobody else knows. - Aristotle Onassis
author: Aristotle Onassis

quote: In every walk with nature, one receives far more than he seeks. - John Muir
author: John Muir

quote: The earth does not belong to us; we belong to the earth. - Marlee Matlin
author: Marlee Matlin

quote: Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better. - Albert Einstein
author: Albert Einstein

quote: A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you. - Elbert Hubbard
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Friendship is born at that moment when one person says to another: ‘What! You too? I thought I was the only one.’ - C.S. Lewis
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: The only way to have a friend is to be one. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear, not absence of fear. - Mark Twain
author: Mark Twain

quote: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are. - E.E. Cummings
author: E.E. Cummings

quote: The best way out is always through. - Robert Frost
author: Robert Frost

quote: Creativity is intelligence having fun. - Albert Einstein
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The chief enemy of creativity is ‘good’ sense. - Pablo Picasso
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: To practice any art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow. - Kurt Vonnegut
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: To keep the body in good health is a duty… otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear. - Buddha
author: Buddha

quote: The greatest wealth is health. - Virgil
author: Virgil

quote: Take care of your body. It’s the only place you have to live. - Jim Rohn
author: Jim Rohn

quote: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other. - Audrey Hepburn
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: Love recognizes no barriers. - Maya Angelou
author: Maya Angelou

quote: We are most alive when we’re in love. - John Updike
author: John Updike

quote: Peace begins with a smile. - Mother Teresa
author: Mother Teresa

quote: An eye for an eye only ends up making the whole world blind. - Mahatma Gandhi
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: There is no way to peace, peace is the way. - A.J. Muste
author: A.J. Muste

quote: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all. - Helen Keller
author: Helen Keller

quote: The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only one page. - Saint Augustine
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Adventure is worthwhile in itself. - Amelia Earhart
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: Fall seven times, stand up eight. - Japanese Proverb
author: Japanese Proverb

quote: The wound is the place where the light enters you. - Rumi
author: Rumi

quote: You may have to fight a battle more than once to win it. - Margaret Thatcher
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: The important thing is not to stop questioning. - Albert Einstein
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Curiosity is the wick in the candle of learning. - William Arthur Ward
author: William Arthur Ward

quote: I have no special talents, I am only passionately curious. - Albert Einstein
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes. - Marcel Proust
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Innovation is the ability to see change as an opportunity, not a threat. - Steve Jobs
author: Steve Jobs

quote: The future is not something we enter. The future is something we create. - Leonard I. Sweet
author: Leonard I. Sweet

quote: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul. - Emily Dickinson
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Everything that is done in the world is done by hope. - Martin Luther
author: Martin Luther

quote: Once you choose hope, anything is possible. - Christopher Reeve
author: Christopher Reeve

quote: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much. - Helen Keller
author: Helen Keller

quote: Coming together is a beginning, staying together is progress, and working together is success. - Henry Ford
author: Henry Ford

quote: None of us is as smart as all of us. - Ken Blanchard
author: Ken Blanchard

quote: Gratitude turns what we have into enough, and more. - Melody Beattie
author: Melody Beattie

quote: The root of joy is gratitude. - David Steindl-Rast
author: David Steindl-Rast

quote: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. - Oprah Winfrey
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become. - Zig Ziglar
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today. - Franklin D. Roosevelt
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Change is the end result of all true learning. - Leo Buscaglia
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: The secret to happiness is freedom, and the secret to freedom is courage. - Thucydides
author: Thucydides

quote: Liberty, when it begins to take root, is a plant of rapid growth. - George Washington
author: George Washington

quote: Freedom is nothing but a chance to be better. - Albert Camus
author: Albert Camus

quote: Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time. - Thomas Merton
author: Thomas Merton

quote: Every artist was first an amateur. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Art is not what you see, but what you make others see. - Edgar Degas
author: Edgar Degas

quote: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere. - Martin Luther King Jr.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: The moral arc of the universe is long, but it bends toward justice. - Theodore Parker
author: Theodore Parker

quote: Justice is truth in action. - Benjamin Disraeli
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Energy and persistence conquer all things. - Benjamin Franklin
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop. - Confucius
author: Confucius

quote: Success is the result of perfection, hard work, learning from failure, loyalty, and persistence. - Colin Powell
author: Colin Powell

quote: Strength lies in differences, not in similarities. - Stephen Covey
author: Stephen Covey

quote: We all should know that diversity makes for a rich tapestry, and we must understand that all the threads of the tapestry are equal in value. - Maya Angelou
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Diversity is the one true thing we all have in common. - Unknown
author: Unknown

quote: True humility is not thinking less of yourself; it is thinking of yourself less. - C.S. Lewis
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Pride makes us artificial and humility makes us real. - Thomas Merton
author: Thomas Merton

quote: Humility is the solid foundation of all virtues. - Confucius
author: Confucius

quote: Travel makes one modest, you see what a tiny place you occupy in the world. - Gustave Flaubert
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step. - Lao Tzu
author: Lao Tzu

quote: To travel is to take a journey into yourself. - Danny Kaye
author: Danny Kaye

quote: Empathy is seeing with the eyes of another, listening with the ears of another, and feeling with the heart of another. - Alfred Adler
author: Alfred Adler

quote: When you show deep empathy toward others, their defensive energy goes down, and positive energy replaces it. - Stephen Covey
author: Stephen Covey

quote: Empathy is about finding echoes of another person in yourself. - Mohsin Hamid
author: Mohsin Hamid

quote: The life of a man consists not in seeing visions and in dreaming dreams, but in active charity and in willing service. - Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: What you leave behind is not what is engraved in stone monuments, but what is woven into the lives of others. - Pericles
author: Pericles

quote: A legacy is not leaving something for people. It's leaving something in people. - Peter Strople
author: Peter Strople
